creator: maxhearn@aol.com
text:
The JSP compiler does not recognize ---%> (note the three dashes) as
ending a JSP comment that was started with the <%-- sequence. 

Examples:
The following are treated as valid JSP comments:
   <%-- Hello --%>
   <%-- Hello x--%>

The following is treated as an unterminated comment:
   <%-- Hello ---%>
   
A JSP comment is defined informally in the JSP 1.2 spec as:
   <%-- anything bug a closing --%> ... --%>

It is defined formally in the JSP 2.0 spec as:
   '<%--' JSPCommentBody
   JSPCommentBody ::= ( Char* - ( Char* '--%>' ) ) '--%>'


Test case to reproduce the problem:

HelloWorld.jsp:
<%-- Comment ---%>
<html>
<head>
<title>Hi</title>
</head>
<body>
Hey there
</body>
</html>

Output when running this:
type Exception report

message 

description The server encountered an internal error () that prevented it from 
fulfilling this request.

exception
